unnormalised: Delhi Jal Board reports that water consumption shot up by 20% in the last week of May '24, with some areas seeing an even bigger jump. Experts are blaming the heat wave. They said the average Delhiite used 180 liters/day, which is way above the normal 150 ltrs. DJB also noted a spike in complaints about low water pressure in areas like Dwarka & Rohini.
normalised: Delhi Jal Board reports that water consumption shot up by twenty percent in the last week of May twenty twenty four, with some areas seeing an even bigger jump. Experts are blaming the heat wave. They said the average Delhiite used one hundred and eighty liters per day, which is way above the normal one hundred and fifty liters. D-J-B also noted a spike in complaints about low water pressure in areas like Dwarka and Rohini.

unnormalised: Apparently, some households are guzzling water like it’s going out of style, watering their lawns even when it’s scorching hot. DJB’s urging folks to be more responsible, especially since the monsoon is playing hide-and-seek. Areas with high consumption might face stricter monitoring.

unnormalised: The electricity bills are also looking scary, with a jump of almost 30% compared to last May. BSES Yamuna Power Ltd (BYPL) pointed fingers at AC usage, saying folks are cranking up the cooling 24/7. Expect to shell out a lot more dough this month.
normalised: The electricity bills are also looking scary, with a jump of almost thirty percent compared to last May. B-S-E-S Yamuna Power Limited (B-Y-P-L) pointed fingers at A-C usage, saying folks are cranking up the cooling twenty four seven. Expect to shell out a lot more dough this month.

unnormalised: There's been a plea to use 5-star rated appliances and set ACs at 25°C to save both energy & money. Simple things like switching off lights when leaving a room can make a difference too. Think of the planet and your wallet, folks!
normalised: There's been a plea to use five star rated appliances and set A-C-s at twenty five degree celsius to save both energy and money. Simple things like switching off lights when leaving a room can make a difference too. Think of the planet and your wallet, folks!

unnormalised: So, it’s a double whammy – more water, more electricity, and bigger bills. Time to be smart about our usage and not take these resources for granted. Let's see if we can bring down the consumption figures next month.
